editorialNotes.short: Something's very wrong here. Can you get out alive?

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

ios.subtitle: Take command in World War II

editorialNotes.standard: This acclaimed platformer motivates you to to brush off mistakes and charge back into battle again and again.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Limbo is a gripping blend of stark, haunting landscapes, bizarre characters and unsettling sounds. With clever puzzle design, an intriguing narrative and an excellent touch-screen control system, it’s as rewarding to play as it is interesting to look at and listen to.
editorialNotes.short: Dark, haunting, beautiful. This'll stay with you long after it's over.

editorialNotes.standard: Pencil in time for nostalgic cannon duels in this hand-drawn reimagining of an old-school classic, where cannonballs fly while scribbled tumbleweeds bounce across graphite landscapes.

Sure, there are skateboarding games that let you pull 900s from telephone wires, then land in a manual, collecting millions of points. But when you want realism and complexity, you want True Skate. For years, True Axis’ skateboarding simulator has been letting us ollie, grind and kickflip with our fingers. Competing with your friends, scouting gaps and completing missions is great fun, but the true reward is perfecting a line and nailing incredible tricks with just the right swipes.

editorialNotes.tagline: A wild sprint to the finish

editorialNotes.standard: You’re a goat, free to run wild and cause mayhem in a virtual town. And trust us: that premise leads to tons of hilarious moments and stunts. We’ve crashed parties, head-butted cars, bounced on trampolines, and done a million other goofy things in this outrageous sandbox game.

editorialNotes.tagline: Clean up Gotham one brick at a time

editorialNotes.standard: It only takes about five minutes to realize just how strange Severed is. But to rescue your family, you’re going to have to dive right in, mastering the excellent swipe-based combat, travelling through a magical realm filled with danger, and—yeah—collecting some severed limbs. Like we said, it’s a little weird. But this Apple Design Award winner is also gorgeous, atmospheric, and totally memorable.

The makers of the awesomely chaotic Does Not Commute have returned with a very different sort of game, casting you as a lab tech who must recapture subatomic particles as they drift away from an atomic core. Connecting coloured dots might sound simple enough, but every neuron in your decidedly non-mechanical brain will be firing as you extend your particle strings and snag valuable score multipliers. Soothing ambient music perfectly complements the intense focus required to master each rewarding level. Who said lab work was boring?
The latest in this gorgeous, long-running tower defence series adds cool twists, like playing with two heroes at once.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

ios.subtitle: It’s not a bug, it’s a feature
Feed Hungry Fish And Grow Big

editorialNotes.tagline: Still trying to get over it TBH
Don't let the zombies stop you

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: The concept behind Kingdom Rush Frontiers is exceptionally simple: take the same great ideas, visual style, and fiendishly difficult tower defense that millions fell in love with in the original game and improve it by adding tons of incredible content. Frontiers packs new heroes, settings, towers, and tons of fresh enemies to fend off, making the frenzied action even harder to put down.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Deliver packages to rebuild a ravaged society–and unravel supernatural mysteries–in this wild post-apocalyptic adventure crafted by legendary game maker Hideo Kojima.

The unstoppable, poppable Bloons series gets better with each installment, and this entry in the cute-but-cunning tower-defense franchise is no exception. Bloons TD 5 is adorable and quirky, but there’s an astonishing amount of content, tactical depth, and replayability to go along with the goofy weapons, helium-filled interlopers, and priceless monkey business.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: If they see you coming, it’s too late! Your mind is still your best weapon in the updated version of this sneaky 2006 action game.

editorialNotes.tagline: Or just bundle up and enjoy the ride.
Join the battle for Bikini Bottom

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: How far can you roll a sphere down a super-steep, never-ending ramp before falling off? Find out in this devilishly tough but instantly accessible score-based racing game—a masterpiece whose simple controls and wonderfully minimalist presentation will keep you coming back again and again. Whether you stick to the road with precision driving or fling yourself into the unknown with wild jumps, you’ll be engrossed and pushed to your limits.

editorialNotes.short: This stylish runner made a big impact when it first launched, and it's still a blast.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: We love BioWare for Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic and their other epic role-playing games, but this particular gem from their back catalog shines like a glorious green dragon. Infused with Chinese myth and populated by unforgettable characters, Jade Empire: Special Edition is a beautiful update of the classic action-RPG. The intuitive touch controls make it that much easier for us to get lost in its massive, martial-arts world of intrigue, adventure—and even a bit of romance.
editorialNotes.short: Try this remastered classic from the makers of Mass Effect.

name: Fury Unleashed
artistName: Awesome Games Studio Sp. z o.o.

editorialNotes.standard: Badland is an eerie sidescroller in which you guide a nondescript creature through creepy and perilous environments. Thanks to simple controls and obvious objectives, the game is instantly accessible, but winding levels and unique power-ups make each stage an exercise in careful timing and hasty strategies. As the gameplay evolves and becomes increasingly bizarre, Badland remains incredibly fun.

Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The game’s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TV—we feel like we’re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.
Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Talk about using your head! Gain the powers of skeletal warriors by swapping your skull with theirs in this challenging 2D action game.
Catchy music, incredible combo-filled combat, co-op play, and a blast of nostalgic spirit ensures this classic brawling series still packs a punch.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
